page.title: 18A Cleobury House
page.content: I live at number four Curdale Close. My house is made of brick. It is forty two years old. It was built during the second world war by the Ministry of Supply for key workers at Muller's Factory who came to Cleobury Mortimer when their London factory was bombed out at the beginning of the war, during the Blitz. The houses have flat roofs which were designed for people to watch for fires during the war. Our sitting room has fourteen inch thick walls all around it and was known as a shelter room. Mum and dad's bedroom is also made the same way. Our house has two large bedrooms and a smaller one where dad keeps his model trains. Also upstairs is a bathroom and a toilet. Downstairs we have a living room and a sitting room, together with a kitchen and outside verandah.
